title: Ticket #5551: Improve classad ingestion performance by presizing hash table
description: When we read a classad off the wire, the first thing we read is how many attributes it will have. The classad implementation stores the set of name-value pairs in a hash table. By default, this hash table is born small, and is resized as attributes are inserted. This resizing can be expensive. By exposing a rehash method, we can tell the classad at birth how many attributes to expect (as least initially). Tests show this improves the speed of classad ingestions almost 10%.
remarks: After discussion, cherry picked back to 8.5.3
